SENT.plain: In low risk myelodysplastic syndrome (MDS), increased apoptosis of marrow cells is a reproducible finding
Several studies have demonstrated elevated levels of tumor necrosis factor-alpha (TNF-alpha) in MDS
Soluble tumor necrosis factor receptor (TNFR:Fc) can eliminate biologically active TNF in vivo
This data provided the rationale for a clinical trial of TNFR:Fc in low risk MDS
Eligibility was limited to cytopenic MDS patients with < 10% marrow blasts
The study design was to administer 25mg TNFR:Fc twice a week for 10 weeks
No responses were observed in the 10 treated patients and one had disease progression
At this dosing schedule, TNFR:Fc is unlikely to ameliorate cytopenias in low risk MDS
